fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs

Interface IFileSystemService


  • @SystemService
public interface IFileSystemService
    Provides access to virtual filesystems and file-manipulation facilites.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String KEY_MEDIA_ASSETS_URI
      The template data context key that should be used to pass a reference to the base content URI when merging template data into a template file.
      static String MEDIA_ASSETS_FOLDER
      Folder name for physical directory for media file assets.
      static String MEDIA_ASSETS_URI
      Relative URI for accessing media file assets.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Creates a filesystem view using the specified driver.

      Creates a filesystem view using the specified root directory.

      Gets a physical filesystem for a subfolder within the assets subfolder.

      Parses a filename to extract the extension, if any.

      IPath getPath(String path, IFileSystemDriver fs)
      Converts a string into a structured path attached to the specified filesystem.

    • Field Detail

      • MEDIA_ASSETS_FOLDER

        static final String MEDIA_ASSETS_FOLDER
        Folder name for physical directory for media file assets. Such files are available for inclusion in ViewShell output, and are external to theme packs.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IConfigService.getAssetsPath(), getMediaFileSystem(), Constant Field Values

      • MEDIA_ASSETS_URI

        static final String MEDIA_ASSETS_URI
        Relative URI for accessing media file assets.

        Content for media assets is made available by appending the path of media content to this base URI. The path to media content is accessible via the media file system.

        This base URI is relative to the embedded HTTP server's endpoint. It starts and ends with "/".

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        KEY_MEDIA_ASSETS_URI, IThemeService.THEME_MEDIA_URI, Constant Field Values

      • KEY_MEDIA_ASSETS_URI

        static final String KEY_MEDIA_ASSETS_URI
        The template data context key that should be used to pass a reference to the base content URI when merging template data into a template file.

        This will be relative to the media assets URI.

        The value associated with this key starts and ends with "/".

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ITemplateData.put(String, Object), ITemplateFile.merge(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes.ITemplateData, java.io.Writer), MEDIA_ASSETS_URI, Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        IPath getPath(String path,
              IFileSystemDriver fs)
        Converts a string into a structured path attached to the specified filesystem.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to convert, which should be non-null and always start with "/".
        fs - the non-null filesystem to which the path is to be attached.
        Returns:
        the path.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path is invalid.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFileExtension

        String getFileExtension(String fileName)
        Parses a filename to extract the extension, if any. The extension (if any) will be converted to lower-case and exclude the preceeding "." character.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name to parse.
        Returns:
        the lower-case extension (non-empty sequence of characters following the last occurrence of "." in the filename) or null if no non-empty extension can be parsed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getMediaType

        IMediaType getMediaType(String fileName)
        Determines the MIME type of the specified file name by parsing the extension and comparing it with mappings for known extension types. A default MIME type of "application/octet-stream" is used when parsing fails or when the extension is unknown.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name to parse.
        Returns:
        the matching mapped MIME type or the default, or null if fileName is null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IHttpService.getFileContentType(CharSequence)

      • createView

        IFileSystemView createView(IFileSystemDriver usingDriver)
        Creates a filesystem view using the specified driver.
        Parameters:
        usingDriver - driver to use.
        Returns:
        the view.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the driver is null or not managed by this service.
        Since:
        1.0

      • createView

        IFileSystemView createView(Path rootDirectory,
                           boolean enableWrites,
                           boolean enableFileWatching)
        Creates a filesystem view using the specified root directory. The view will become invalid if the specified root directory is deleted after creation.
        Parameters:
        rootDirectory - the physical root directory for the virtual filesystem.
        enableWrites - enables modifications via the virtual filesystem when the physical filesystem allows it, when this is set to true, otherwise prevents all modifications via this API when this is set to false.
        enableFileWatching - enables activation of file watchers via the virtual filesystem when the physical filesystem allows it, when this is set to true, otherwise prevents activation when this is set to false.
        Returns:
        the view.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if the root directory is not a directory.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAssetsFileSystem

        IFileSystemView getAssetsFileSystem(String assetsSubfolder)
        Gets a physical filesystem for a subfolder within the assets subfolder.
        Parameters:
        assetsSubfolder - the non-null and non-empty name of the folder to get or create. Names can contain letters and numbers, hyphens, underscores, and period characters from the ASCII character set.
        Returns:
        a filesystem object for the specified subfolder.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if the filesystem cannot be provided.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IConfigService.getAssetsPath()

      • getMediaFileSystem

        IFileSystemView getMediaFileSystem()
        Gets the media assets filesystem. By default, this corresponds to the media folder in the assets directory.
        Returns:
        the media filesystem.
        Since:
        1.0
